title: Fannie, Freddie Regulator Sets New Caps on Lending for Multifamily Properties
text:
WASHINGTON—The federal regulator of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac moved Friday to set new caps on the total amount of loans for multifamily rental properties that the mortgage-finance companies are allowed to purchase, one of the first efforts by Trump-appointed officials to revamp the companies’ businesses.

The Federal Housing Finance Agency plans to limit the amount to $100 billion for each company over the five quarters from Oct. 1. It also plans to eliminate existing exemptions from such caps for “green” loans—or lending...
description: The federal regulator of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac moved to cap the total amount of loans for multifamily rental properties that the mortgage-finance companies are allowed to purchase each year.
